trans-unit.source: Using the SugarCRM Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the SugarCRM Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the SugarCRM Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the SugarCRM Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: SugarCRM connector lets you create and modify different entities such as Accounts, Leads, Contacts, and so on.
trans-unit.target: SugarCRM connector lets you create and modify different entities such as Accounts, Leads, Contacts, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Following are the typical integration scenarios that involve SugarCRM:
trans-unit.target: Following are the typical integration scenarios that involve SugarCRM:

trans-unit.source: Account Synchronization between SugarCRM and ERP systems such as SAP
trans-unit.target: Account Synchronization between SugarCRM and ERP systems such as SAP

trans-unit.source: Account, Contacts and Leads synchronization between Marketo and SugarCRM
trans-unit.target: Account, Contacts and Leads synchronization between Marketo and SugarCRM

trans-unit.source: Order to Cash flow from SugarCRM to ERP systems
trans-unit.target: Order to Cash flow from SugarCRM to ERP systems

trans-unit.source: As part of Connector package settings, you can choose entities the connector can manage and the actions, input and output parameters are dynamically populated.
trans-unit.target: As part of Connector package settings, you can choose entities the connector can manage and the actions, input and output parameters are dynamically populated.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the SugarCRM Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the SugarCRM Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Following are the different actions available in SugarCRM connector:
trans-unit.target: Following are the different actions available in SugarCRM connector:

trans-unit.source: Create Module - Use this action to create a new record for SugarCRM module such as Accounts, Leads, Contacts.
trans-unit.target: Create Module - Use this action to create a new record for SugarCRM module such as Accounts, Leads, Contacts.

trans-unit.source: Update Module - Use this action to update an existing record for SugarCRM module.
trans-unit.target: Update Module - Use this action to update an existing record for SugarCRM module.

trans-unit.source: Delete Module - Use this action to delete an existing record for SugarCRM module.
trans-unit.target: Delete Module - Use this action to delete an existing record for SugarCRM module.

trans-unit.source: List Module - Use this action to list filtered records.
trans-unit.target: List Module - Use this action to list filtered records.

trans-unit.source: If no query is specified then all records are returned.
trans-unit.target: If no query is specified then all records are returned.

trans-unit.source: Get Module - Use this action to retrieve a single record from specified module.
trans-unit.target: Get Module - Use this action to retrieve a single record from specified module.

trans-unit.source: Get Record Count - Use this action to get the number of records in the module that match the query.
trans-unit.target: Get Record Count - Use this action to get the number of records in the module that match the query.

trans-unit.source: If no query is specified then total number of records in the module are returned.
trans-unit.target: If no query is specified then total number of records in the module are returned.

trans-unit.source: Check Duplicate Module - Use this action to check for duplicate records within a module.
trans-unit.target: Check Duplicate Module - Use this action to check for duplicate records within a module.

trans-unit.source: Note: For more details on the supported arguments in a query, refer to SugarCRM REST API documentation.
trans-unit.target: Note: For more details on the supported arguments in a query, refer to SugarCRM REST API documentation.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to portal.azure.com.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to portal.azure.com.

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure Marketplace using the + NEW option at the top left corner of the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure Marketplace using the + NEW option at the top left corner of the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Browse to “Marketplace > Everything” and search for “SugarCRM”.
trans-unit.target: Browse to “Marketplace > Everything” and search for “SugarCRM”.

trans-unit.source: Configure the SugarCRM Connector by providing the details for App Service Plan, the Resource Group and entering the name of the API App.
trans-unit.target: Configure the SugarCRM Connector by providing the details for App Service Plan, the Resource Group and entering the name of the API App.

trans-unit.source: Configure the SugarCRM Connector package settings.
trans-unit.target: Configure the SugarCRM Connector package settings.

trans-unit.source: Following are the package settings you would need to provide to create the connector:
trans-unit.target: Following are the package settings you would need to provide to create the connector:

trans-unit.source:
Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- Site URL | Yes | Enter the URL of your SugarCRM instance. For example, enter https://abcde1234.sugarcrm.com. Client Id | Yes | Enter the consumer key of OAUTH 2.0 key in SugarCRM. Client Secret | Yes | Enter the consumer secret of OAUTH. Username | Yes | Enter the username of SugarCRM user. Password | Yes | Enter the password of the SugarCRM user. Module Names | Yes | Enter the SugarCRM modules (such as Accounts, Contacts, Products) on which you want to perform operation

Example: Accounts, Leads, Contacts
trans-unit.target:
Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- Site URL | Yes | Enter the URL of your SugarCRM instance. For example, enter https://abcde1234.sugarcrm.com. Client Id | Yes | Enter the consumer key of OAUTH 2.0 key in SugarCRM. Client Secret | Yes | Enter the consumer secret of OAUTH. Username | Yes | Enter the username of SugarCRM user. Password | Yes | Enter the password of the SugarCRM user. Module Names | Yes | Enter the SugarCRM modules (such as Accounts, Contacts, Products) on which you want to perform operation

Example: Accounts, Leads, Contacts

trans-unit.source: Let us create a simple logic app that creates an account in SugarCRM and updates billing address details of the same account.
trans-unit.target: Let us create a simple logic app that creates an account in SugarCRM and updates billing address details of the same account.

trans-unit.source: Login to Azure Portal and click on ‘New -> Web + mobile -> Logic App’: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Login to Azure Portal and click on ‘New -> Web + mobile -> Logic App’: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the ‘Create logic app’ page, provide the required details such as name, app service plan and location: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: In the ‘Create logic app’ page, provide the required details such as name, app service plan and location: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on ‘Triggers and Actions’ and the Logic App editor screen comes up.
trans-unit.target: Click on ‘Triggers and Actions’ and the Logic App editor screen comes up.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Run this logic manually’ which means that this logic app can be invoked only manually.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Run this logic manually’ which means that this logic app can be invoked only manually.

trans-unit.source: Expand ‘API Apps in this resource group’ in Gallery to see all the available API Apps.
trans-unit.target: Expand ‘API Apps in this resource group’ in Gallery to see all the available API Apps.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘SugarCRM’ from the gallery and the ‘SugarCRM connector’ gets added to the flow: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Select ‘SugarCRM’ from the gallery and the ‘SugarCRM connector’ gets added to the flow: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Create Account’ action and the input parameters are displayed: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Create Account’ action and the input parameters are displayed: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Provide name as 'Microsoft Account' and click ✓: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Provide name as 'Microsoft Account' and click ✓: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select ‘SugarCRM Connector’ from the ‘Recently Used’ section in the gallery and a new SugarCRM action gets added.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘SugarCRM Connector’ from the ‘Recently Used’ section in the gallery and a new SugarCRM action gets added.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Update Account’ (this will be under advanced actions '...') from the list of actions and the input parameters of ‘Update Account’ action are displayed: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Update Account’ (this will be under advanced actions '...') from the list of actions and the input parameters of ‘Update Account’ action are displayed: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on ‘...’ next to ‘Record Id’ to pick the "id" value from the output of ‘Create Account’ action: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click on ‘...’ next to ‘Record Id’ to pick the "id" value from the output of ‘Create Account’ action: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Provide values for billing address information and click ✓: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Provide values for billing address information and click ✓: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on OK on Logic app editor screen and then click 'Create'.
trans-unit.target: Click on OK on Logic app editor screen and then click 'Create'.

trans-unit.source: It will take approximately 30 seconds for the creation to complete.
trans-unit.target: It will take approximately 30 seconds for the creation to complete.

trans-unit.source: Browse the newly created Logic App and click on 'Run Now' to initiate a run.
trans-unit.target: Browse the newly created Logic App and click on 'Run Now' to initiate a run.

trans-unit.source: You can check that a new account by name 'Microsoft Account' gets created in your SugarCRM account and the same account is also updated with billing address information.
trans-unit.target: You can check that a new account by name 'Microsoft Account' gets created in your SugarCRM account and the same account is also updated with billing address information.

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
